intro: Jondraba cichoriifolia var. hispida, commonly known as the hispid jondraba, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, bristly leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
